010package imagingbook.common.ij;
011
012import java.awt.Dimension;
013import java.awt.Rectangle;
014import java.awt.Toolkit;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.WindowManager;
022import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
023import ij.gui.ImageCanvas;
024import ij.gui.ImageWindow;
025import ij.plugin.ScreenGrabber;
026
027/**
028 * Defines static helper methods related to ImageJ's GUI.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2020/10/09
032 * @version 2022/09/15
033 */
034public abstract class GuiTools {
035        
036        private GuiTools() {}
037        
038        public static final String DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE = "Choose image";
039        
040        /**
041         * Queries the user to select one of the currently open images.
042         * 
043         * @param title   name of the dialog window (if null,
044         *                {@link #DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE} is used)
045         * @param exclude image to exclude from being selected (typically the current
046         *                image)
047         * @return a reference to the chosen image ({@link ImagePlus}) or null, if the
048         *         dialog was cancelled
049         */
050    public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage(String title, ImagePlus exclude) {
051                if (title == null) {
052                        title = DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE;
053                }
054                int[] imgIdsAll = WindowManager.getIDList();
055                if (imgIdsAll == null) {
056                        IJ.error("No images are open.");
057                        return null;
058                }
059
060                List<Integer> imgIdList   = new ArrayList<Integer>(imgIdsAll.length);   // use a Map instead?
061                List<String>  imgNameList = new ArrayList<String>(imgIdsAll.length);
062                
063                for (int id : imgIdsAll) {
064                        ImagePlus img = WindowManager.getImage(id);
065                        if (img!=null && img != exclude && img.isProcessor()) {
066                                imgIdList.add(id);
067                                imgNameList.add(img.getShortTitle());
068                        }
069                }
070                
071                if (imgIdList.size() < 1) {
072                        IJ.error("No other images found.");
073                        return null;
074                }
075                
076                Integer[] imgIds   = imgIdList.toArray(new Integer[0]);
077                String[]  imgNames = imgNameList.toArray(new String[0]);
078                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title, null);
079                gd.addChoice("Image:", imgNames, imgNames[0]);  
080                gd.showDialog();
081                if (gd.wasCanceled())
082                        return null;
083                else {
084                        int idx = gd.getNextChoiceIndex();
085                        return WindowManager.getImage(imgIds[idx]);
086                }
087    }
088    
089        /**
090         * Queries the user to select one of the currently open images.
091         * 
092         * @param title name of the dialog window (if null,
093         *              {@link #DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE} is used)
094         * @return a reference to the chosen image ({@link ImagePlus}) or null, if the
095         *         dialog was cancelled
096         */
097        public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage(String title) {
098                return chooseOpenImage(title, null);
099        }
100        
101        /**
102         * Queries the user to select one of the currently open images.
103         *
104         * @return a reference to the chosen image ({@link ImagePlus}) or null, if the
105         *         dialog was cancelled
106         */
107    public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage() {
108        return chooseOpenImage(null, null);
109    }
110    
111    // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
112    
113        /**
114         * Modifies the view of the given {@link ImagePlus} image to the specified
115         * magnification (zoom) factor and the anchor position in the source image. The
116         * size of the image window remains unchanged. The specified anchor point is the
117         * top-left corner of the source rectangle, both coordinates must be positive.
118         * The method fails (does nothing and returns {@code null}) if the resulting
119         * source rectangle does not fit into the image. If successful, the view is
120         * modified and the resulting source rectangle is returned. Otherwise
121         * {@code null} is returned.
122         * 
123         * @param im            the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
124         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
125         * @param xa            the x-coordinate of the anchor point
126         * @param ya            the y-coordinate of the anchor point
127         * @return the resulting source rectangle if successful, {@code null} otherwise
128         */
129        public static Rectangle setImageView(ImagePlus im, double magnification, int xa, int ya) {
130                ImageCanvas ic = im.getCanvas();
131        if (ic == null) {
132                IJ.showMessage("Image has no canvas.");
133            return null;
134        }
135        
136        Dimension d = ic.getPreferredSize();
137        int dstWidth = d.width;
138        int dstHeight = d.height;
139        
140        int imgWidth = im.getWidth();
141        int imgHeight = im.getHeight();
142        
143        if (xa < 0 || ya < 0) {
144                throw new IllegalArgumentException("anchor coordinates may not be negative!");
145        }
146        
147        if (magnification <= 0.001) {
148            throw new IllegalArgumentException("magnification value must be positive!");
149        }
150        
151        // calculate size of the new source rectangle
152        int srcWidth  = (int) Math.ceil(dstWidth / magnification); // check!!
153        int srcHeight = (int) Math.ceil(dstHeight / magnification);
154        
155        if (xa + srcWidth > imgWidth || ya + srcHeight > imgHeight) {
156                // source rectangle does not fully fit into source image
157                return null;
158        }
159        
160        Rectangle srcRect = new Rectangle(xa, ya, srcWidth, srcHeight);
161        ic.setSourceRect(srcRect);
162        im.repaintWindow();
163        
164                return srcRect;
165        }
166        
167        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
168        
169        private static final int DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_X = 10; // horizontal screen margin
170        private static final int DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_Y = 30; // vertical screen margin
171        
172        /**
173         * Resizes the window of the given image to fit an arbitrary, user-specified
174         * magnification factor. The resulting window size is limited by the current
175         * screen size. The window size is reduced if too large but the given
176         * magnification factor remains always unchanged. <br>
177         * Adapted from https://albert.rierol.net/plugins/Zoom_Exact.java by Albert
178         * Cardona @ 2006 General Public License applies.
179         * 
180         * @param im            the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
181         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
182         * @param marginX       horizontal screen margin
183         * @param marginY       vertical screen margin
184         * @return true if successful, false otherwise
185         */
186        public static boolean zoomExact(ImagePlus im, double magnification, int marginX, int marginY) {
187//              TODO: Check calculation of source rectangle, final magnification may not always be exact!
188                ImageWindow win = im.getWindow();
189                if (null == win)
190                        return false;
191                ImageCanvas ic = win.getCanvas();
192                if (null == ic)
193                        return false;
194                
195                if (magnification <= 0.001) {
196                        return false;
197                }
198
199                // fit to screen
200                Dimension screen = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize();
201                int maxWidth  = screen.width - marginX;
202                int maxHeight = screen.height - marginY;
203                double w = Math.min(magnification * im.getWidth(), maxWidth);
204                double h = Math.min(magnification * im.getHeight(), maxHeight);
205                                
206                Rectangle sourceRect = new Rectangle(0, 0, (int) (w / magnification), (int) (h / magnification));
207                try {
208                        // by reflection:
209                        Field f_srcRect = ic.getClass().getDeclaredField("srcRect");
210                        f_srcRect.setAccessible(true);
211                        f_srcRect.set(ic, sourceRect);
212                        ic.setSize((int) w, (int) h);
213                        ic.setMagnification(magnification);
214                        win.pack();
215                        im.repaintWindow();
216                        return true;
217                }
218                catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
219                return false;
220        }
221        
222        /**
223         * Convenience method for {@link #zoomExact(ImagePlus, double, int, int)} using
224         * default screen margins.
225         * 
226         * @param im            the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
227         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
228         * @return true if successful, false otherwise
229         */
230        public static boolean zoomExact(ImagePlus im, double magnification) {
231                return zoomExact(im, magnification, DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_X, DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_Y);
232        }
233        
234        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
235        
236        /**
237         * Returns the current magnification (zoom) factor for the specified
238         * {@link ImagePlus} instance. Throws an exception if the image is currently not
239         * displayed.
240         * 
241         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
242         * @return the magnification factor
243         */
244        public static double getMagnification(ImagePlus im) {
245                ImageWindow win = im.getWindow();
246                if (win == null) {
247                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot get magnification for non-displayed image");
248                }
249                return im.getWindow().getCanvas().getMagnification();
250        }
251
252        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
253        
254        /**
255         * Captures the specified image window and returns it as a new {@link ImagePlus}
256         * instance. Uses ImageJ's built-in {@link ScreenGrabber} plugin.
257         * 
258         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
259         * @return a new image with the grabbed contents
260         */
261        public static ImagePlus captureImage(ImagePlus im) {
262                return new ScreenGrabber().captureImage();
263        }
264        
265}
